i1.name: Prophet of an Elder God
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} Periodically, '''Illaoi''' spawns a {{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}} on a nearby impassable terrain if no other Tentacles are nearby. Tentacles fully spawn after a 2 second delay and are {{tip|untargetable}} in the meantime.

{{as|Tentacles|buzzword2}} deal {{pp|10 to 180}} {{as|(+ 120% AD)}} {{as|(+ 40% AP)}} {{tip|Physical Damage|{{as|physical damage}}}} to all enemies struck when commanded to attack by her abilities. Each {{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}} also {{tip|heal|heals}} '''Illaoi''' for {{as|5% '''missing''' health}} if it hits at least one enemy {{tip|champion}}. ''See [[#Pets|Pet Details]] for more details.''
i1.notes:
* '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword2}}''''' do not spawn in the [[Nexus Obelisk|Nexus Obelisk's]] attack range and on ally invulnerable {{tip|turrets|structures}}.
* Impassable terrain also includes player-made terrain and terrain that is passable by a team but not by the other, for example base gates.
* The '''''{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}''''' will continue its spawn animation and be able to start an attack, after the animation ends, even if '''Illaoi''' or a '''''{{as|Vessel|buzzword3}}''''' are not nearby.
* If '''Illaoi''' uses ''{{ai|Harsh Lesson}}'' during '''''{{as|Tentacles'|buzzword2}}''''' spawn animation, they won't attack but the SFX of the attack will still be heard.
** If this happens, after the '''''{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}''''' finishes its spawn animation, it will be unable to start an attack for its remaining attack SFX.

q1.name: Tentacle Smash
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Illaoi''' slams her idol into the ground, summoning a {{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}} that slams down in the target direction, dealing {{as|physical damage}} before disappearing.
q1.notes:
* Getting {{tip|airborne|displaced}} during the cast time will not change the indicator on the ground, but it will change the damaged area, while still being directed towards the previous pointed location. 
* If '''Illaoi''' is not {{tip|sight|visible}}, the slam will be seen but it will not be heard.

w1.name: Harsh Lesson
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Illaoi's''' next [[basic attack]] within 6 seconds gains {{sti|range|225 '''bonus''' range}} and causes her to {{tip|dash|leap}} to her target if they're beyond her normal basic attack range.

The attack deals {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}}, with a minimum threshold, and capped at 300 against non-champions, and commands all {{as|Tentacles|buzzword2}} in range to attack her target. The minimum bonus damage can also be applied against {{tip|turrets}}.
w1.notes:
* Since the attack applies both on-hit effects and spell effects it will trigger {{ii|Muramana}} twice.
* ''Harsh Lesson'' is made of two different abilities which are decided by '''Illaoi''' being close to the target or in dash range.
* The close range one:
** It's {{tip|unstoppable}}, meaning no effect can interrupt it other than death, '''Illaoi's''' or the target's. Using {{si|Flash}} or {{ii|Zhonya's Hourglass}} will cancel the animation but the attack will still land.
** Starting the attack before getting in {{iis|Guardian Angel}} passive and hitting while she's in it will not make '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword2}}''''' slam.
** Starting the attack before the target becomes {{tip|untargetable}} will still make '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword2}}''''' slam on the target.
** Does trigger {{ri|Hail of Blades}}.
** Triggers {{ii|Kircheis Shard|Energized}} and {{ii|Spear of Shojin|Awakened}} effects [[on-hit]].
** Using it at the same time with {{ii|Ravenous Hydra}} will perform an unusual dunk.
* The dash range one:
** It's not unstoppable, meaning that effects can interrupt it during the dash and put it cooldown. {{si|Flash}} and {{ii|Zhonya's Hourglass}} cannot be used during the dash.
** Starting the attack before the target becomes {{tip|untargetable}} will not make '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword2}}''''' slam.
** Does not trigger {{ri|Hail of Blades}}.
** Triggers {{ii|Kircheis Shard|Energized}} and {{ii|Spear of Shojin|Awakened}} effects [[on-attack]].
** Having enough attack speed will perform an unusual dunk.
** Having increased size will increase the range of her ''Harsh Lesson'' but the indicator range will not change.
* While {{tip|ground|grounded}} or {{tip|root|rooted}} ''Harsh Lesson'' cannot be cast.
** If casted before being ''grounded'', only the close range version may be used, and the attack commands will be negated while being in dash range.
* {{tip|spell shield|Spell shields}} will block the '''bonus''' damage but will not prevent the '''''{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}''''' slam, unless a dash range ''Harsh Lesson'' has been used, in which case the '''bonus''' damage is not blocked but the ''spell shield'' is still consumed.
* Parries ({{ai|Counter Strike|Jax}}, {{ai|Spirit's Refuge|Shen}}, {{ai|Blinding Dart|Teemo}}) will block the damage and will not trigger {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}}} slams, with the exception of:
** {{ai|Spirit's Refuge|Shen}} when using a close range ''Harsh Lesson'', which triggers {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}}} slams.
** {{ai|Blinding Dart|Teemo}} when using a dash range ''Harsh Lesson'', which both deals damage and triggers {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}}} slams.
* If the target dies at the moment ''Harsh Lesson'' hits the target, it will be consumed and put on cooldown, without making '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword2}}''''' slam.
* The '''''{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}''''' attacking because of ''Harsh Lesson'' is considered to be part of it, and thus will not grant additional stacks of {{ri|Conqueror}}, {{ri|Electrocute}}, {{ri|Phase Rush}} and {{ii|Spellthief's Edge|Tribute}}.
* ''Harsh Lesson'' triggers {{ri|Bone Plating}} and one of its plates with the same attack.
* Attack moving while charging {{si|Hexflash}} will delay the attack.

e1.name: Test of Spirit
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Illaoi''' fires a projectile in the target direction, stopping at the first enemy hit. If the enemy is a {{tip|champion}}, their {{as|Spirit|buzzword}} is pulled in front of '''Illaoi''' over {{fd|0.75}} seconds. The target is tethered to the {{as|Spirit|buzzword}} for {{tt|7 seconds|Timer starts when the spirit is being pulled}}, granting '''Illaoi''' {{tip|true sight}} of it.

The {{as|Spirit|buzzword}} has the target's {{sti|health|{{as|'''current''' health}}}}, {{sti|{{as|armor}}}} and {{sti|mr|{{as|magic resist}}}}, and redirects a portion of the pre-mitigation damage received to the tethered champion.

When the {{as|Spirit|buzzword}} is killed or the target moves too far away, the tether is severed, {{tip|slow|slowing}} the target by 80% for {{fd|1.5}} seconds and marking them as a ''Vessel'' for 10 seconds, {{tip|sight|revealing}} the area around them for a few seconds.
Each {{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}} autonomously attacks the closest ''Vessel'' or {{as|Spirit|buzzword}} once every {{pp|3|5.5 to 3.5|1 to 13|formula=5.5-1 every 6 lvls. Cooldown starts upon starting the slam}} seconds.

{{sbc|Vessel:}} Enemies made a ''Vessel'' spawn a {{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}} near themselves every {{pp|3|5 to 3|1 to 13}} seconds, ceased by {{tip|takedown|taking down}} '''Illaoi'''. {{as|Tentacles|buzzword2}} can spawn exceptionally closer to each other than when spawned by '''Illaoi'''.
e1.notes:
* '''''{{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirits|buzzword}}}}''''' are classified as [[Champion summoned units#Decoy|Decoys]]. ** The '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}''''' can only be targeted by '''Illaoi's''' team and neutral monsters--the '''''{{as|Spirit's|buzzword}}''''' allies cannot target it, unless it's from an [[auto-targeted]] effect (i.e {{si|Heal}}). *** Towers will not increase their damage per shot when attacking it, and they will also deal 50% reduced damage to it. ** '''''{{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirits|buzzword}}}}''''' cannot be {{tip|heal|healed}} or {{tip|shield|shielded}}. *** {{ri|Summon Aery}} is an exception, and even if the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}} doesn't take any damage because of the shield, the redirected damage still inflicts it. ** It's immune to {{tip|stasis}}. ** The only stat connected to the '''''{{as|Vessel|buzzword2}}''''' is their level. Leveling up is the only way to increase their {{as|health}}, {{as|armor}} and {{as|magic resist}} after it's been pulled out. When this happens, the '''''{{as|Spirit's|buzzword}}''''' lifetime also increases by 1 second. ** Killing it rewards {{g|25}} and {{as|{{sti|Experience|44}}}}. * {{tip|Spell shield|Spell shields}} will only prevent your '''''{{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}}''''' from being grabbed. ''Spell shields'' will not prevent you from becoming a '''''{{as|Vessel|buzzword3}}''''' or prevent '''''{{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacles|buzzword2}}}}''''' from attacking you, although they can be used to block a '''''{{as|Tentacle's|buzzword2}}''''' attack. * The tentacle model of the first cast is connected to '''Illaoi's''' body and will stop moving when '''Illaoi''' does (e.g {{tip|stasis}}, {{tip|sleep}}, {{tip|airborne}}). However, the projectile will not, and will be able to hit enemies away from its model position. It will also not be seen by enemies if '''Illaoi''' is not {{tip|Sight|visible}}, but it will be heard if the tentacle passes through their vision. * Using {{si|Flash}} during the cast time will change '''Illaoi's''' position but the tentacle will still be directed towards the previous pointed location. * Grabbing the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}''''' of a champion that has their resource bar white (i.e {{tip|Flow}}) will make the '''''{{as|Spirit's|buzzword}}''''' lifetime (the white bar below the lifebar) disappear. * Grabbing the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}''''' of a target that is {{tip|camouflage|camouflaged}} while there’s a control ward revealing them will make the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}''''' invisible. * The tentacle will not grab the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}''''' of {{ci|Sion}} during his {{ai|Glory in Death|Sion}}. However, grabbing it before ''Sion'' initially dies causes the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}''''' to remain during ''Sion's'' ''Glory in Death'', thus still being able to become a '''''{{as|Vessel|buzzword3}}'''''. * The target will only get slowed after the tether returns back to it and not instantly. * Only '''Illaoi''' can see who's been '''''{{as|Vesseled|buzzword3}}'''''. * Redirected damage is calculated by taking the premitigation damage, applying it to ''Test of Spirit's'' modifier, and then cap it to the '''''{{as|Spirit's|buzzword}}''''' {{as|'''current''' health}}. This damage will then be affected by damage modifiers of the enemy champion. ** The damage shown being received by the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}} is not representative of the damage redirected to the {{as|Vessel|buzzword3}}, as the combat text shown adjacent to the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}} factors the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit's|buzzword}}}} modifiers - which may be different from the {{as|Vessel's|buzzword3}} (e.g different resistances, {{ri|Coup de Grace}}). *** Stacking {{ri|Press the Attack}} on the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}} will only increase the damage against the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}} and not against the enemy champion. ** In a hypothetical situation, if both the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}} as the target have 50% damage reduction from {{as|armor}}, the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}} has {{as|500 HP}}, and it receives 1000 damage (before resistances), while ''Test of Spirit'' has 60% ratio, redirected damage won’t be 1000{{times}}0.6{{times}}0.5{{equals}}300 but it will be 1000{{times}}0.6{{equals}}600, is 600 less than 500 ({{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit's|buzzword}}}} {{as|'''current''' health}})? No, then redirected damage is 500{{times}}0.5{{equals}}250.
If instead of being dealt 1000 damage in 1 hit, it would've been dealt in 2 hits, 500 each, the results would have been these: 500{{times}}0.6{{equals}}300 less than 500 (Yes) 300{{times}}0.5{{equals}}150 redirected damage (first hit)
In the meantime the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}} took 500{{times}}0.5{{equals}}250 damage
Same thing for second hit, 500{{times}}0.6{{equals}}300 less than 250(No) 250{{times}}0.5{{equals}}125 redirected damage (second hit)
The {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}} reached {{as|0 HP}} because of having taken 250 damage twice.
Total redirected damage{{equals}}150{{plus}}125{{equals}}275 *** Even if total damage dealt to the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}} is the same in both cases, total redirected damage is higher if it's dealt with less powerful attacks. * Damage transferred to the target will apply damage-type specific effects such as {{ii|The Black Cleaver}}, {{ii|Morellonomicon}}, {{ii|Executioner's Calling}}, or the healing from {{ii|Death's Dance}} / {{ii|Hextech Gunblade}}, determined by who dealt the damage. ** It will not trigger on-hit effects or spell effects versus the target ({{ri|Scorch}}, {{ii|Wit's End}}) although the damage of those effects dealt to the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}} will be transferred. * Attacking both the enemy and its {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}} at the same time will have the enemy receive only one {{ii|The Black Cleaver}} stack. * {{ii|Spellthief's Edge|Tribute}} and {{ri|Predator}} only reflect double bonus damage, not taking into account actual damage done to the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}} (e.g if {{ri|Predator}} would deal 60 bonus damage, what would get reflected is 120 damage). * {{ri|Electrocute}} / {{ri|Phase Rush}} / {{ii|Spellthief's Edge|Tribute}} stacks can be put on the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}} but redirected damage won't apply any stack on the enemy champion. * The redirected damage from triggering {{ri|Conqueror}} on the ''Spirit'' will benefit from the true damage and will be amplified by the bonus ad (the triggered ''Conqueror'' damage usually doesn't benefit from either). * Attacking the ''Spirit'' with {{ri|Conqueror}} will redirect {{fd|15.36%}} of the damage as {{tip|true damage}}, before ''Test of Spirit's'' modifier. * Runes statistics will consider the damage being done to the spirit. * {{ai|Riposte|Fiora}} can prevent from becoming a {{as|Vessel|buzzword3}} if used before the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}} gets killed or while {{ai|Lunge|Fiora|lunging}} out of the tether's range. * If a champion is made a {{as|Vessel|buzzword3}} while {{ii|Guardian Angel|reviving}}, it will revive without being one. * If the target becomes a {{as|Vessel|buzzword3}} in a dormant {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle's|buzzword2}}}} attack range, that {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}}} will be prevented from doing its first attack. * Once the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword}}}} vanishes (it doesn't need to be killed) '''Illaoi''' will get {{iis|Phage|Rage}} full movement speed bonus and 1 creep score in-game (the bonus cs won't be shown in the end of game screen).

r1.name: Leap of Faith
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Illaoi''' leaps into the air {{tip|unstoppable|unstoppably}} before slamming her idol into the ground, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to nearby enemies. For each enemy champion hit, a {{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}} is summoned for 8 seconds (up to a maximum of 6 summons).

For the duration, {{ais|Harsh Lesson|Illaoi}} {{sti|cooldown}} is halved, all {{as|Tentacles|buzzword2}} awakened by '''Illaoi''' are {{tip|untargetable}}, will not show their hitboxes, nor go dormant, and will take half the amount of time to make an attack.
r1.notes:
* '''Illaoi''' is immune to {{tip|stasis}} while in her cast animation.
* {{si|Flash}} can be used during the cast time.
* [[Decoy]]s also count as champions for the '''''{{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}}}''''' summoning.
* '''Illaoi''' spawns the '''''{{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}}}''''' 725 range away from her, unless there's a natural wall blocking the way making the '''''{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}''''' spawn on it, based on:
** The direction she's facing.
*** She will always face at the nearest {{tip|sight|visible}} enemy champion, in ''Leap of Faith's'' range, the instant she leaps.
*** If there's no enemy champion nearby, she faces in the direction of the cursor.
*** {{si|Flash|Flashing}} mid-animation will change the spawning direction to where the cursor is pointed, regardless of the nearest enemy champion.
** How many champions she hits.
*** 1+ champions: one {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}}} at 0 degrees.
*** 2+ champions: one {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}}} at 60 degrees.
*** 3+ champions: one {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}}} at 300 degrees.
*** 4+ champions: one {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}}} at 120 degrees.
*** 5+ champions: one {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}}} at 240 degrees.
*** 6+ champions: one {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}}} at 180 degrees.
** If there're no walls nearby, spawning the last {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword2}}}} will form a perfect hexagon.
* {{tip|Spell shield|Spell shields}} will block the ability's damage but will not prevent '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword2}}''''' from spawning.
* Activating {{ii|Guardian Angel}} during the leap will not stop the ability from doing damage or spawn '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword2}}'''''.
* Using ''{{ai|Harsh Lesson}}'' after '''Illaoi''' drops down will command '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword2}}''''' to instantly attack, regardless if they were already attacking. Their old attack will keep on going and will hit while the second attack is on its animation attack.
* Using ''{{ai|Harsh Lesson}}'' an instant before ''Leap of Faith's'' buff finishes will delay the '''''{{as|Tentacle's|buzzword2}}''''' attack.
